title: From Machine Learning to Deep Learning: The Dynamic Role of AI in Microscopy Applications
content: The microscopy image analysis workflow encompasses several steps, beginning with sample loading, followed by the definition of regions of interest (ROIs), and the configuration of experimental parameters such as magnification and illumination. Subsequent steps involve the analysis of various regions and objects, such as grains and phases. Historically, these steps relied heavily on manual intervention. However, AI-driven automation has revolutionized these microscopy workflows, leading to increased throughput and high reproducibility.
